zone.line: professing himself a judge of music
the s song & rhapsody{,} was
competent to criticize Olympus
Th{\} Thamyris, Orpheus, or Phemius
Of Ithaca, the raphsodist; but
xthe moment he came to Ion the
Ephesian felt himself quite
He but requites me for his own misdeed{;}
at a loss, & utterly incompetent
to determine whether he rhapso
-dized well or ill. Ion. I cannot
refute you Socrates{;--} but of this
I am conscious in myself that
I excell all men in the profusion
& eloquence of my illustrations of
Homer; and that all who hear
me will confess it; & that with
respect to other poets, I am deserted
by this power; it is for you to
consider what may be the cause of
this. Soc. Methinks I can explain
unfold to you, o Ion, what my opinion
